==Economics==
==Economics==
â
{{as of|2011|6}}, there are just over 6.5 million bitcoins in existence. This figure is algorithmically determined as described in Nakamoto's whitepaper. Because by definition, the only spendable Bitcoins in existence are those represented in the block chain database passed around on the peer to peer network, the number is not only easy to determine, but can be quickly determined with precision by all participants.<ref name="whitepaper" />
+
{{as of|2011|6}}, there are just over 6.5 million bitcoins in existence{{fact}}. This figure is algorithmically determined as described in Nakamoto's whitepaper. Because by definition, the only spendable Bitcoins in existence are those represented in the block chain database passed around on the peer to peer network, the number is not only easy to determine, but can be quickly determined with precision by all participants.<ref name="whitepaper" />
Bitcoins are currently accepted in some cases for a small number of online services, work for hire, tangible goods, and charitable donations.<ref name="bitcointrade">{{cite web |url=https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Trade |title=Bitcoin Trade |publisher=Bitcoin wiki |accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> Traders buy and sell bitcoins through exchange sites.<ref>{{cite news |title=The Currency That's Up 200,000% |first=Jack |last=Hough |url=http://www.smartmoney.com/invest/stocks/the-currency-thats-up-200000-1307029053200/ |newspaper=[[SmartMoney]] |date=2011-06-03 |accessdate=2011-06-08}}</ref><ref>{{cite news
